value.title: DAX Measure in the Axis of the Power BI Report
value.excerpt: If you even need to show your DAX measures in a chart without a dimension to slice and dice it, you won’t get a great experience in the visual. In this video, I’ll share a trick that you can use to have a nice visualization like what you see in the above screenshot. Download the file and study more from

value.title: Dynamic Banding or Grouping in Power BI   Using DAX Measures   Choose the Count of Bins
value.excerpt: Banding (or binning or grouping) is a scenario that can be implemented both statically and dynamically in Power BI. Dynamic banding means selecting the bin (or band) configuration, and the banding changes based on the user selection of the slicer. Imagine that we have a count of customers by their age

value.title: Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI with Exclude and Include Rules
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how to implement a dynamic row-level security pattern when you have a value that you want to exclude. value.title: Exception Reporting in Power BI Catch the Error Rows in Power Query
value.excerpt: To build a robust BI system, you need to cater for errors and handle errors carefully. If you build a reporting solution that the refresh of that fails everytime an error occurs, it is not a robust system. Errors can happen by many reasons, In this video, I’ll show you a way to catch potential errors

value.title: Export the Data of a Power BI table entirely in a few Clicks
value.excerpt: If you want to export the data of a Power BI table, you have options such as copy and paste, or putting it in a visual and export it. However, there is an easier way available too. You can use Power BI Helper (free tool) to export the entire data of the table. The instruction below explains how it is

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
